unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th – As manufacturers ramp up production for the Diwali season, concerns are surfacing regarding quality control amidst the pressure to meet deadlines. Industry experts, citing data from the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), point to a potential dip in standards across several sectors, particularly textiles and electronics.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth – As manufacturers ramp up production for the Diwali season, concerns are surfacing regarding quality control amidst the pressure to meet deadlines. Industry experts, citing data from the Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I), point to a potential dip in standards across several sectors, particularly textiles and electronics.

unnormalised: "The 'jugaad' mentality, while often praised, can sometimes compromise rigorous testing and quality assurance," noted Dr. Sharma, a professor specializing in supply chain management at IIT Bombay. This comes as the market witnesses a surge in demand, reminiscent of the festive film "Baghban," where family members are overwhelmed by expectations.

unnormalised: Several SMEs in Ludhiana, known for their hosiery, have reportedly faced challenges adhering to stringent quality checks due to labor shortages and material procurement delays. The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has also increased its vigilance on processed food items to prevent substandard products from reaching consumers. Maintaining robust quality control, experts urge, is crucial for long-term brand reputation and consumer trust. Rs. 50,000 penalties can be levied for each violation.
